boardgame.name: Here Come the Rebels
boardgame.description: This is the second game in the Great Campaigns of the American Civil War series. It covers the Antietam campaign._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;(from the back of the box:)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;This simulation of the Antietam campaign is the second volume in Avalon hill's new series of strategic Civil War games._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Unlike most Civil War games, which concentrate on specific battles, Here Come the Rebels! portrays an entire two-week military campaign. The Confederate player's objective is to secure Maryland for the South, the Union player's goal is to drive the Rebel army out of Maryland. Here Come the Rebels! is easy to learn, and several scenarios can be played to completion in an hour._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The two beautiful maps in the game portray northern Virginia and Maryland as it was in 1862, including roads, turnpikes, railroads, rivers, mountains, cities, and towns. These highly accurate maps are based on original Civil War maps in state and county archives. In the game, players control Union and Confederate armies in turns representing one day of real time. The game's interactive system of play assures that each scenario will be unpredictable, exciting and competitive. An extensive historical article, detailing the day-to-day activities of the actual campaign, is included in the game. Here Come the Rebels! is sure to appeal to all those with an interest in this dynamic period of American history._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;FEATURES _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Corps Leaders * Infantry and Cavalry units _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Artillery values * Union forts * Railroad movement _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Force marches * Burning Railroad stations * Rain _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Union command paralysis * Union garrison of Harpers Ferry _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Flank attacks * Grand assaults _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Depots * Foraging * Pennsylvania Militia _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; C_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp;O Canal aqueduct_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;SCENARIOS _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; South Mountain _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Harpers Ferry-Crampton's Gap _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; McClellan's Opportunity _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; The Baltimore Raid _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; The Battle for Washington _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; From Frederick to Sharpsburg (Advanced Game, short version) _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; The Maryland Campaign (Advanced Game, long version) _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; How to Join Stonewall Jackson's Way (Volume I) with 'Here Come the Rebels! _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;CONTENTS: _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;2 Counter Sheets _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;2 22_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; x 32_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; Mapsheets _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Rules Booklet _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;2 Charts and Tables Cards _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;3 Display Cards _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;2 6-sided dice _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;1 Counter Tray_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;TIME SCALE: One day per turn_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;MAP SCALE: One mile per hex_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;UNIT SCALE: Divisions and brigades (with corps leaders)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;PLAYERS: One, two, or teams_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;PLAYING TIME: 1 hour for introductory scenarios, 2 to 12 hours for other scenarios_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

listing.notes: This game was a preorder.
This game is in mint unplayed condition, all counters are unpunched
Unpunched. Excellent condition.

This is a 1993 Avalon Hill edition. The game is complete and the pieces are unpunched. All components are in excellent condition and appear never to have been handled or played. The only thing wrong with this set is there is some corner wear to all 4 box top corners and one of the corners taped where it split. The box bottom shows some water damage (contents completely untouched by water as the plastic tray must have been in the bottom of the box). The top of the box is still shiny and looks great. S_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;H is $8.50 via USPS Priority Mail to all 50 states. Combined shipping may be available on multiple purchases. Other shipping arrangements are available upon request but may vary in cost. Pennsylvania shipping addresses should include 6% sales tax. **VERY FAST SHIPPING - 2-4 business days once payment received**
Never played. Counters punched. Plastic storage tray included. Postage to US/Europe is included in the price.

Never played, complete game. A few of the chits have come loose and are in plastic bag, most of the game is unpunched. Game is in great condition.
